comment._content: Trying to immagine what their lives were like......

comment.author: 26109214@N05
comment._content: Amazing photo - such a different time. People will have been living many to a room with  no indoors sanitation.

comment.author: 30225433@N08
comment._content: Notice how all the children are barefoot.

comment.author: 7621733@N02
comment._content: That looks a pretty tough life.

comment.author: 36950137@N08
comment._content: Any idea where this would be in modern Glasgow?

comment.author: 10758109@N04
comment._content: Fabulous...had a g g g aunt born in Saltmarket in 1844...gives me an idea of what this area would have looked like :-))

comment.author: 12265145@N03
comment._content: Reminds me of the Jeely Piece Song by Adam McNaughtan, lamenting the mass migration in the 1960s from tenements to high-rise flats. A funny song every Glasgow -raised adult will likely remember. This has the words and a link to Adam singing it near the bottom: www.roblightbody.com/scotland/scotlandjeely.htm

comment.author: 88897761@N00
comment._content: there was a time when people were not alone watching tv and reloading facebook pages inside their apts, eating fast food.

comment.author: 22797338@N03
comment._content: I'm researching my family tree, and found that one branch all came from Saltmarket / Bridgegate so these are the places they would have lived in. I love seeing photos like this that really help to build a picture of their past.
